incidents.name: Alerts Irregularities for US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 13:22 and 14:40 UTC, some customers experienced lag in Alerts across all products in the US region. 

We’ve resolved the issue with alerts for all products in the US region. Services have returned to their normal operation.
Some customers are experiencing an issue with Alerts in the US region. We will update this page as we resolve the issue.

incidents.name: Infrastructure On-Host Integrations irregularities for US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between January 9th - 18:29 UTC and January 10th - 11:50 UTC, some customers experienced missing custom attributes across some Infrastructure On-Host Integrations. Data will not be recovered.

We’ve resolved the issue with UI and alerts for Infrastructure On-Host Integrations in the US region. Services have returned to their normal operation.

affected_components.name: Data Ingest : US - Infrastructure Agent : US

incident_updates.body: We have identified the issue with UI and alerts for Infrastructure On-Host Integrations in the US region. Notifications are impacted for some customers. We’re working to resolve it.

incident_updates.body: Some customers are experiencing an issue with UI and alerts for Infrastructure On-Host Integrations in the US region. We will update this page as we resolve the issue.

incidents.name: UI Irregularities in the EU Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 19:13 UTC and 22:30 UTC on January 3rd, some customers in the EU region may have experienced issues logging into the New Relic platform and viewing some UI elements due to lost connectivity between New Relic and a cloud service provider.

We investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

affected_components.name: UI : Europe - Auto-Telemetry with Pixie : EU
UI : Europe - AWS Lambda Integration : Europe

incident_updates.body: We are continuing to work to restore network connectivity between New Relic and a cloud service provider. We are seeing recovery for some affected services and will be providing an update once system stability has been ensured. Meanwhile, some customers in the EU region may still be experiencing issues with login or viewing some UI elements.

incident_updates.body: We are continuing to investigate a network connectivity issue between New Relic and a cloud service provider that may be preventing some users in the EU region from logging into the New Relic platform and loading some UI elements.

incident_updates.body: We have identified a network connectivity issue between New Relic and a cloud service provider that may be preventing some users in the EU region from logging into the New Relic platform and loading some UI elements. We're continuing to investigate with our upstream provider and will provide updates on this page as they become available.

incident_updates.body: Some users in the EU region may be experiencing difficulties logging in to the New Relic platform and some UI elements may not be loading as expected. We're investigating and will provide additional details as they become available.

incidents.name: Alert Notification Delays for the US Region

incident_updates.body: Between 19:45 UTC and 20:10 UTC on January 3rd, some customers in the US region may have experienced delayed alert notifications of up to 12 minutes behind real time. We investigated and resolved this service interruption, impacted services have returned to normal operation.

incidents.name: Ingest Delays for the US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 2:08 am and 2:46 am UTC, some customers experienced delays with ingest. Notifications were impacted for some customers between 2:11 am and 2:36 am UTC.

We’ve resolved the issue with ingest delays in the US region. Services have returned to their normal operation.

incidents.name: Synthetics Alerts Delays for US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 4:37 UTC December 18, 2022 and 6:30, some customers experienced delays in Synthetics Alerts.

We’ve resolved the issue with alerts for Synthetics in the US region. Services have returned to their normal operation.
We have identified the issue with alerts for the Synthetics product in the US region. Notifications are impacted for some customers. We’re working to resolve it.

incidents.name: Delayed billing data in the US

incident_updates.body:
Between 00:21 UTC and 01:24 UTC on December 17, some customers in the US region may have experienced Delayed billing data.
We have investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operations.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Trace Data Ingest Latency in EU Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 20:30 UTC, December 15th and 00:04 UTC, December 16th, some customers in the EU region may have experienced delays for distributed trace data.

We investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

affected_components.name: Data Ingest : Europe - Trace API : Europe

incident_updates.body: We are seeing signs of service recovery as we continue to investigate an issue that may impact distributed trace data ingest for some customers in the EU region. We will continue to provide updates here as we work to resolve this interruption.

affected_components.name: Data Ingest : Europe - Trace API : Europe

incident_updates.body: Some customers in the EU region may be experiencing delays for distributed trace data. We are investigating and will provide more information as it becomes available. Please continue to monitor this page for updates.

affected_components.name: Data Ingest : Europe - Trace API : Europe

incidents.name: Alert Irregularities in US Region

incident_updates.body: From December 12th to December 13th, some customers in the US region may have experienced alert notifications remaining open even after the triggering violation(s) were closed.  We investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

incidents.name: Synthetics data delays for the EU Region

incident_updates.body: Between 12:30 UTC and 14:47 UTC, some customers may have experienced delays in Synthetics checks and related alert notifications. We’ve resolved the issue with Synthetics in the EU region and services have returned to their normal operation.
Some customers in the EU region may be experiencing delays for results from Synthetics checks and alerting related to Synthetics. We will update this page as we work to resolve the issue.

incidents.name: Alert Delays in EU Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 22:26 UTC and 22:54 UTC on December 8th, some customers in the EU region may have experienced delayed and/or missing alert notifications. 

We have resolved the issue with alert notifications for customers in the EU region and services have returned to normal operation.

Between 22:26 UTC and 22:54 UTC on December 8th, some customers in the EU region may have experienced delayed and/or missing alert notifications. 

To prevent our customers from receiving a high volume of falsely triggered positive alert notifications during this interruption, alerts were temporarily suppressed for applicable customers between 22:46 UTC and 22:54 UTC. We've identified and corrected the source of alert latency and services have returned to their normal operation. We are continuing to monitor to validate a full recovery.
Some customers in the EU region may be experiencing delayed and/or missing alert notifications. We are investigating and will provide updates on this page as they become available.

incidents.name: Synthetics Private Location Errors in US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 19:00 UTC and 23:17 UTC on December 6th, some customers in the US region may have experienced errors when viewing, creating, or editing private synthetics locations and when editing or creating synthetics monitors.

We investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

incidents.name: UI Irregularities in EU Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 17:53 UTC and 18:24 UTC on December 6th, some customers in the EU region may have experienced degraded UI performance, such as UI elements and charts failing to load.

We investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

incidents.name: Data Ingest Irregularities in the US Region

incident_updates.body: Between 19:32 UTC and 20:57 UTC on December 5th, some customers in the US region may have experienced latency in data ingest and missing and/or delayed alert notifications for related data. We've identified a service interruption with an upstream cloud provider which has since been resolved and services have returned to normal operation.

incidents.name: Alert Notifications Unavailable for US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 16:20 UTC and 17:06 UTC on October 26th, some customers in the US region may have experienced errors when connecting new APM agents, as well as missing alert notifications.

We investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

incident_updates.body: Impacted services have returned to their normal operation and we are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

incidents.name: Data Ingest Errors in US and EU Regions

incident_updates.body:
Between 14:25 UTC and 17:55 UTC on October 25th, some customers in the US and EU regions may have experienced intermittent data ingest for various products. Alert notifications were impacted for some customers in the EU region between 17:26 UTC and 17:55 UTC.

Our cloud service provider identified and corrected the issue and all impacted services have returned to their normal operation.

incidents.name: New Relic Unavailable for US and EU Regions

incident_updates.body: Between 16:42 UTC and 19:43 UTC on October 7th, we investigated and resolved a network connectivity issue. Customers in the US and EU regions may have experienced issues with the New Relic UI, alert notifications, and data collection for some data types during this time. All impacted services have returned to normal operation.

affected_components.name: Data Ingest : US - Event API : US
Data Ingest : US - Metric API : US
Data Ingest : Europe - Event API : Europe
Data Ingest : Europe - Metric API : Europe

incidents.name: Continuation of Mobile Alerts and UI Delays for US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 14:27 UTC September 3, 2022 and 17:43 UTC, some customers experienced lag in Mobile data. Notifications were impacted for some customers between 14:32 UTC and 17:43 UTC.

We’ve resolved the issue with UI and alerts for Mobile in the US region. Services have returned to their normal operation.
Continuation of previous incident.
